exposr 0.0.1
  • Reference

Simulate Dose-Response Data from an Exponential Model

Source: R/simulate_exponential.R
simulate_exponential.Rd

Simulates data from an exponential response model: $$pred = e0 + e1 * (1 - exp(-k * dose))$$

simulate_exponential(
  dose_levels,
  n_per_dose,
  e0,
  e1,
  k,
  sigma,
  dist = "normal",
  df = 3,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

dose_levels

Numeric vector of dose levels.

n_per_dose

Either a single integer (equal sample size per dose) or a vector matching `dose_levels`.

e0

Baseline effect. Can be a scalar or a vector.

e1

Maximum effect.

k

Rate constant (controls curve steepness).

sigma

Standard deviation for residual error.

dist

Residual error distribution: `"normal"` (default), `"lognormal"`, `"uniform"`, `"t"`, or `"gamma"`.

df

Degrees of freedom for t-distribution.

seed

Optional seed for reproducibility.

Value

Data frame with columns: `id`, `dose`, `pred`, `ipred`, `scenario`.

Details

All combinations of `e0`, `e1`, and `k` will be simulated.

Examples

simulate_exponential(
  dose_levels = c(0, 1, 5, 10),
  n_per_dose = 10,
  e0 = 0, e1 = 1, k = 0.2,
  sigma = 0.2,
  dist = "normal",
  seed = 200
)
#>    id dose      pred        ipred          scenario
#> 1   1    0 0.0000000  0.016951269 e0=0, e1=1, k=0.2
#> 2   2    0 0.0000000  0.045292068 e0=0, e1=1, k=0.2
